Posts.Content: ekenny315 wrote: Well i went to the emergencey room on 3/15 (My wedding Anniversary & Sons 4th Birthday) and was diagnosed with brain mets. CRAAAAAAAAAAPPPPPP i just had expanders put in 4 weeks ago. I can't even get my words out right, my brain is frazzled!!!! to say the least. I have had two  rad treatments so far and will continue to so for 8 more days. I need to hear stories.....great ones. Please Help - i have 2 little boys and a dear husband - if no stories, questions, i want to know if this plan of action is the correct protocol. AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA Sorry i'm having a a slight pity party and im inviting you to come well help me : / Erika Dx 3/15/2009, IDC, 1cm, Stage IV, Grade 3, 16/22 nodes, mets, ER-/PR-, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: It hasn't even been a year :( HELP! ekenny315 Makratz

Posts.Content: Mar 19, 2009 10:38AM ekenny315 wrote: had to take my steroids so im up now , Ryan will be getting up for school vry soon. Than you for all of the encouraging words. To answer some of the questions: Yes i'm receiving whole brain rads. The lesions are spread out (6)  3 in the back and 3 in or on the cerebellum. Symptoms were pain, pressure & slight vomiting. - Lisa, i needed that story thanks a bunch. Keep em coming : ) see i'm starting to smile already.
Posts.Title: It hasn't even been a year :( HELP! ekenny315 Makratz

Posts.Content: Mar 25, 2009 12:47AM ekenny315 wrote: Thank you all you beautiful women! I have been feeling much better physically & emotionally. I have the greatest support system eva! - I am going to get through this! & thanks to all of you & my family i know & feel in my heart that it is true. I LOVE LIFE!!!!!

Posts.Content: Sep 15, 2009 07:00AM ekenny315 wrote: Hi sweety; i was diagnosed w/ leptomenengeal (sp) in March 09 and i have yet to hear anyone tell me what my life expectancy will be. I am also on carboplatin(IV) once a month. My Onc decided to give me the lumbar puncture with methodextrate (sp) instead of a shunt. that is my last resort and i personally find it too scary. My hair did fall out from the radiation but it's growing back. Please PM me. I also have small children and they give me the will to get through this crap everyday.

Posts.Title: Am I Cancer Free? Firelady evyl78

Posts.Content: ekenny315 wrote: and boy is it uncomfortable, well initially. I feel like someone is sitting on my chest. I was extremely aggravated by everything and anything after surgery. My mom came with me because DH was working. She can't drive and loves the break so my ride home was eventful to say the least. Then we had to p/up Ryan my 4 year old from my MIL (who i later found out was sick). I Went to get my prescription and my son was pushing every button imaginable. I wanted to scream!!! Ok i'm doing better now, and the kids are angels, well naturally, they are sleeping....lol Tomorrow is another day, just needed to vent a little. Erika Dx 3/15/2009, IDC, 1cm, Stage IV, Grade 3, 16/22 nodes, mets, ER-/PR-, HER2- Log in to post a reply
